findings.title: EPC - Existing Pair Creation
findings.description: The contract does not handle the scenario where a pair already exists prior to its execution, causing the createPair function to revert and preventing the successful execution of the updateUniswapV2Router function.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: The contract is using two separate if statements to determine whether the `takeFee` variable should be set to `false`. Both conditions produce the same result and can be optimized by combining them using the logical OR (||) operator.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if the `swapTokensAtAmount` variable is set to a big number, it may trigger a huge token swap, leading to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract uses misleading error messages in `updateBuyFees` and `updateSellFees` functions, stating 'Fees must be less than 3%' when the actual condition is `_marketingFeeOnBuy <= 10` and `_marketingFeeOnSell <= 10`. This makes it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone. It's important to carefully test and debug assembly code to ensure that it is correct and does not contain any errors.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
